kaninator.io
Class Mouse

java.lang.Object
  kaninator.io.Mouse

public class Mouse
extends java.lang.Object

Wraps the functionality in the awt/swing library and provides information about the keystates and the cursor position.

Author:
phedman
See Also:
MouseAdapter, MouseMotionAdapter

Nested Class Summary
private  class Mouse.MouseKeys
          Extends the MouseAdapter class, stores the keystates in an boolean array.
private  class Mouse.MouseMotion
          Extends the MouseMotionAdapter class, stores the coordinates in integers.

Method Detail

getMouseKeys

public Mouse.MouseKeys getMouseKeys()
Accessor method for the MouseKeys object. Used to communicate with the window we want to get events from.

Returns:
The MouseKeys object extending the MouseAdapter class.

getMouseMotion

public Mouse.MouseMotion getMouseMotion()
Accessor method for the MouseMotion object. Used to communicate with the window we want to get events from.

Returns:
The MouseMotion object extending the MouseMotionAdapter class.

isPressed

public boolean isPressed(int button)
Checks if a certain button is pressed at the moment.

Parameters:
button - The mouse button in question (0 - 2).
Returns:
the state of the button true=pressed, false=not pressed.

get_x

public int get_x()
Getter method for the x-coordinate.

Returns:
The x-coordinate of the cursor in relation to the window.

get_y

public int get_y()
Getter method for the y-coordinate.

Returns:
The y-coordinate of the cursor in relation to the window.

moved

public boolean moved(int _x,
                     int _y)
Checks against the values in the parameters if the mouse has been moved.

Parameters:
_x - The old x value to check against
_y - The old y value to check against
Returns:
True if the mouse has moved, otherwise false

clear

public void clear()
Clears the internal button states, setting them to false.
